context: A security incident involving the execution of a known credential theft tool was detected on host `vnevado-win10v`. A file named `mimikatz.exe` was executed with the intention to dump users' credentials, keys, and plain-text passwords. The process ID for this execution was 5196, and it was initiated by an account with the name `tgs2z`.
question: During further investigation, a SID history injection was detected. Can you determine the AadUserId of the account involved in this malicious activity?
solution_steps: A credential theft tool execution was detected, targeting the account with AadUserId `1d94aaf6-efe6-4e76-ad56-ffd7d1257bc1`.
Activity indicative of the use of the Rubeus kerberoasting tool was identified, involving the process `powershell.exe`.
A Security IDentifcation (SID) history injection was detected, involving the account with AadUserId `7fcf9695-68fc-4258-864d-e1e5b166c66f`.
